alert.note: Alert for Shelby; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 2:26AM CST until January 09 at 7:45AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Chilton, Coosa, Shelby, St. Clair and Talladega. * WHEN...Until 530 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Talladega, Sylacauga, Calera, Clanton, Childersburg, Columbiana, Jemison, Wilsonville, Talladega Springs, Weogufka, Vincent, Thorsby, Harpersville, Oak Grove, Billingsley, Bon Air, Lay Lake, Marble Valley, Lay Lake Dam and Strickland Crossroads.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
